[h1]Death Is Not an Escape.[/h1] [h1]Dead by Daylight[/h1] is a multiplayer (4vs1) horror game where one player takes on the role of the savage Killer, and the other four players play as Survivors, trying to escape the Killer and avoid being caught, tortured and killed. Survivors play in third-person and have the advantage of better situational awareness. The Killer plays in first-person and is more focused on their prey. The Survivors' goal in each encounter is to escape the Killing Ground without getting caught by the Killer - something that sounds easier than it is, especially when the environment changes every time you play. More information about the game is available at http://www.deadbydaylight.comâ€¢ Survive Togetherâ€¦ Or Not - Survivors can either cooperate with the others or be selfish. Your chance of survival will vary depending on whether you work together as a team or if you go at it alone. Will you be able to outwit the Killer and escape their Killing Ground? â€¢ Where Am I? - Each level is procedurally generated, so youâ€™ll never know what to expect. Random spawn points mean you will never feel safe as the world and its danger change every time you play. â€¢ A Feast for Killers - Dead by Daylight draws from all corners of the horror world. As a Killer you can play as anything from a powerful Slasher to terrifying paranormal entities. Familiarize yourself with your Killing Grounds and master each Killerâ€™s unique power to be able to hunt, catch and sacrifice your victims. â€¢ Deeper and Deeper - Each Killer and Survivor has their own deep progression system and plenty of unlockables that can be customized to fit your own personal strategy. Experience, skills and understanding of the environment are key to being able to hunt or outwit the Killer. â€¢ Real People, Real Fear - The procedural levels and real human reactions to pure horror makes each game session an unexpected scenario. You will never be able to tell how itâ€™s going to turn out. Ambience, music, and chilling environments combine into a terrifying experience. With enough time, you might even discover whatâ€™s hiding in the fog.
        [h1]Minimum requirements[/h1]
[b]OS[/b]:Windows 10 64-bit Operating System
[b]Processor[/b]:Intel Core i3-4170 or AMD FX-8120
[b]Memory[/b]:8 GB RAM
[b]Graphics[/b]:DX11 Compatible GeForce GTX 460 1GB or AMD HD 6850 1GB
[b]DirectX[/b]:Version 11
[b]Network[/b]:Broadband Internet connection
[b]Storage[/b]:50 GB available space
[/b]Sound Card[/b]:DX11 compatible
[i]Personally i love the game .Try it by yourself and discover your favourite character.Five stars â­â­â­â­â­[/i]

By design this game is awfully flawed. 
Survivors are easily and severely punished. If you're caught even once, on this already claustrophobic map, you're almost always 100% dead. Being placed on a hook, which the killer always camps, you can't unhook yourself(which is like a 1/10 chance anyway) without the killer killing you. All they need to do is camp you/wait for a teammate to try to save you. Then your teammate is dead too like wtf 

Generators take way too much time to complete repairs and is rather difficult

Game is just bad do not recommend. Spend the $10 instead on literally fucking anything else.
